action.action-desc: Mr. Peters submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the Committee on Rules

form.official-title: Amending the Rules of the House of Representatives to require the House to meet 5 days a week for 39 weeks each year.

subsection.text: rule XIV of the Rules of the House of Representatives is amended by adding at the end the following new clause:

rules-clause.text: There shall be votes held in the House or in the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union for 5 consecutive days each week exceptâ€”

rules-paragraph.text: during any recess there shall be no votes, except there shall be not more than 13 recess weeks during each calendar year; or
during any week in which there is a holiday, then votes shall be held on 4 days.

subsection.text: The amendment made by subsection (a) shall take effect with the first session of Congress beginning on the date of adoption of this resolution.
